website_summaries.verdict: This foldable option makes it possible to carry your lock with you no matter where you go.
pros: Comes in four colors: pink, lime, orange, and black
Comes with its own carry case
cons: This item is suggested for "low security risk" areas

customer_reviews.title: Good design, but not going to stop a set of bolt cutters
customer_reviews.text: I had this lock for all of a couple weeks before my bike was stolen (see photo). The folding aspect and the lightness were very appealing and in that respect this lock is solid. Honestly, I know that no bike lock will truly prevent theft from happening, but I can't help but feel like the lock just didn't do it's job.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Bike Stolen
customer_reviews.text: My bike was stolen with this lock- all that was left was the plastic cover over the locking mechanism, leading me to believe it was broken open, versus cutting through the metal bars. I called the company and they have no warranty, they wouldn't replace it or even offer a discount on a new one. I would recommend buying more secure lock from another company.
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Had this lock for a few months now and I 100% prefer this over the traditional U lock. I've left my bike unattended at parking sign posts for weekends and it is always there when I get back to pick it up. It's flexibility lets me lock up my bike in so many more places. The lock mechanism itself is very solid and hasn't shown any signs of rust or key sticking so far. The weight is about the same as a normal U lock but it is much more compact. Definitely recommend for anyone looking for an alternative to the standard bike lock.
customer_reviews.author: Aamir Husain

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly convenient, acceptable security
customer_reviews.text: I love this lock. It's by far the most portable bike lock I've ever owned, but I don't feel like I'm sacrificing too much in terms of security. Sure, it's no high-end u-lock, but it's also far from a flimsy cable lock as well. I'm not sure I'd trust it on a very expensive, multi-thousand dollar bike; but for the couple-hundred-dollar beater I ride, this lock is fantastically convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: These are nice steel bars and I am very confident that bike ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this bike lock because my old U-Bar lock didn't have a mount and would just rattle on my bike all the time. This bike lock has the added benefit of being able to work with any style of bike stand because of its versatility. It mounts well on the vertical bar of my bike and still has room for a water bottle. These are nice steel bars and I am very confident that bike thieves would be deterred by this strong lock.
customer_reviews.author: BSUNG

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: A light but apparently sturdy bike lock. I've had it for a couple of weeks and the only thing that bugs me a bit is that it could be just a bit longer. As it is, it is a tight squeeze to make it reach when I want to wind the lock through the front wheel, the frame and whatever I want to lock the bike to. Other than that, it's great! Looks nice too!
customer_reviews.author: Stubelicious

customer_reviews.title: So far this seem to be as good as an U-lock
customer_reviews.text: So far this seem to be as good as an U-lock, plus being so different I think thieves are deterred from messing with it. The fact that it folds makes it very easy to carry, it's significantly lighter than other locks in this category of safety, and one of the best features is it can be "molded" around your bike and post. I tend to leave the key hold facing down as to discourage thieves from trying to pick it.
customer_reviews.author: Pediatric Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Great Option - Unique form factor
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a higher rating but am concerned about security vs kryptonite. See product reviews for details. I guess I won't know for sure until it is too late. The form factor is great. Its holder attaches to the frame or in a pocket or in a rando bag slot. It is heavy and so will bounce out over rough grade. Very well made. German construction. Much larger opening than kryptonite makes it easier to lock to a variety of objects. Flexible joints also help here.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M. Curry

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Some _____hole tried to clip through this lock when I left it out in NYC for a night and it held up. Saved my $3000 bike as well as The 2-3 months I would've had to wait for a replacement (it's custom). It folds up small enough to fit in my saddle bag too (it's only like 8 inches long when folded). Great lock
customer_reviews.author: Theguelahpapyrus

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock!
customer_reviews.text: This lock is great! I also own a U-lock, which are very good, but this folds up and just takes up a water bottle space on the frame. Then it expands to fit much more than a U-lock can fit which is great when you need flexibility for those occasional poorly designed bike racks out there.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Avery

customer_reviews.title: Compact and secure
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these locks two years ago when I purchased my bike. We recently bought a bike for my wife and how well this has held up and the ease of use made it an easy decision to buy another one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Trusso

customer_reviews.title: Keys don't unlock it
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a great lock! It's so SECURE that the keys won't unlock it. I will report after I return/replace it.
customer_reviews.author: pbike908

customer_reviews.title: Sweet lock
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lock. Fits great, looks great. You can screw into bike attachment holes, or attach with provided Velcro straps. Didn't scratch my bike at all. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jayrrock

customer_reviews.title: Good looking & solid lock that looks like it can ...
customer_reviews.text: Good looking & solid lock that looks like it can withstand terrific force. The locking system bars are easy to manipulate. Feels secure but is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: AD-BD

customer_reviews.title: twice received the standard black instead of the stated color
customer_reviews.text: twice received the standard black instead of the stated color; on top of that, the price is elevated by about 35$ on top of competitors. pitiful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The lock it self is fine, but the holder allows the lock to rattle
customer_reviews.text: The lock it self is fine, but the holder allows the lock to rattle. Higher priced options have a tighter fitting holder.
customer_reviews.author: John Locke

customer_reviews.title: Totes nicely in supplied harness
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat heavy but takes the worry out of theft. Any thief would be a fool to try to remove this lock. Totes nicely in supplied harness.
customer_reviews.author: Hanny1

customer_reviews.title: Quality, heavy duty, cool storage...but heavy in weight also
customer_reviews.text: Quality lock, heavy duty and cool storage. It is heavy in weight so more for long term locking. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am sure it can be cracked, but it meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: We love these locks. We feel like our bikes are safe with these type.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula_pdx

customer_reviews.title: Clever, new lock design.
customer_reviews.text: Cool, secure and tucks cleverly away. Just what I wanted for my high-risk bike in a low-risk town. The longer style would have been more useful, but is quite a bit heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Mylrea Estell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love having this folding lock, provides the u lock security with the cable flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Yogi U lock
customer_reviews.text: My close friends are jealous. Seriously it's that much better than an U lock.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Batridge

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but good.
customer_reviews.text: A bit on bulky and heavy side. Not as big as other solutions. Been happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wood

customer_reviews.title: Nice color, but...
customer_reviews.text: It has an auto lock system, so that you don't need the key to lock it. I figured that would be handy to keep the lock stored unlocked, but ready to lock without the key. I could ride to my destination, wrap the lock around the bike and something solid, and click it closed. But in order to store the lock properly in it's folded up position that fits neatly in the carrying case, it must be locked already. And so I still need the key involved in the process of locking the bike up. So what, then, is the benefit of being able to click the lock closed without the key?
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Soboleff

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and handsome
customer_reviews.text: This lock is reliable, easy to use and handsome. Good job Abus.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Foyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, low price, fast delivery...what can I say. I'd buy again from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice, little bit of bait and switch when you go to order. But overall, the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: steven goodish

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Strong and easy to use. I especially like the frame mount holder. Don't get this if you're worried about weight.
customer_reviews.author: SK91

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but the lock is too small
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, but the lock is too small. It might work in certain situations, but I can't lock the frame to a bike rack at work. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: admccrea

customer_reviews.title: It would not wrap around my bike frame, tire ...
customer_reviews.text: It would not wrap around my bike frame, tire and pole. It also scratched the paint off of the frame of my brand new bike! My friend had a U-lock for her bike which seemed considerably easier to put on and it's smooth so does not have a potential to scratch a bike. This item is going back and being traded for a U-lock.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Lock shipped with wrong key
customer_reviews.text: Lock arrived, seems decent quality. Probably wouldn't stop bolt cutters, but is fine for my needs. However, the provided keys didn't work. I've literally never had this happen with a lock, and now I have to go through the hassle of shipping it back, getting a refund, and then ordering a new lock. Pretty disappointing and seems like they should have QA checks for this sort of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Handy, Medium-Security Lock
customer_reviews.text: As the product page tells you, it's only medium security. Otherwise, it's a great design. It even has a handy bracket/case that straps to a (vertical or diagonal) tube on your bike. The lock is held in the bracket largely by gravity (weak latch, too), so don't put it on a horizontal tube. The lock operates smoothly. You don't need the key to unlock it, but an extra lug makes it hard for someone to reach in and take advantage of the spring-loaded latch. Much more compact than a cable/padlock or U-lock, though still about two pounds to carry around. Recommended. Review of:  Abus Bordo 5700 Folding Lock (Lime) :-)
customer_reviews.author: Alan Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Used it for years and love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this lock on my commuter bike for years and I love it. It's not too heavy, is compact and it's really easy to get lock up and unlock. Takes me maybe 10 seconds to use. I've also had zero attempts to steal my bike while using this on a college campus. Highly recommended. Probably buying a second one for a another bike.
customer_reviews.author: K.B

customer_reviews.title: I broke through in 5 to 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Today i found my bike with a different lock around it. Some prankster thought it to be funny locking my bike with another lock. Needless to say that i didn't have the keys to it. I firtst tried to lockpick it. I don't know how to pick a lock so this really didn't work for me. Using a saw specially designed for iron and available in any hardware store i broke through the lock in 5 to 10 minutes. It then took me 5 more minutes explaining to the police what i was doing and proving that the bike was mine. Would not buy this lock.
customer_reviews.author: olivier Verbruggen

customer_reviews.title: Portable self contained keyed folding lock.
customer_reviews.text: I like the visibility of this lock. I like the portability with included rubberized case that can strap to my bike frame and easy removal with velcro straps. It’s a bit of weight yet easier than wrapping a chain for a trip out. I think the bars can be cut through by bolt cutters, I use this when not far from my bike on trail stops or even to the bike rack in my garage. Little stiff to use on bike rack on car, I think the vibration would scratch the paint of the frame so I have not tried it. I have found I prefer combo locks just because I am worried about losing keys.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Cool design
customer_reviews.text: This folding bike lock ended up being a lot heavier and bulkier than I had expected, but I really like that it folds up neatly and stows away nicely on the bike. It's definitely less of a hassle to store than my old chain lock. The sample I received is a bright lime green color, which is a bit flashy for my taste, but I also don't ever leave my bike locked up in a public place for very long. This is a good product to provide a little piece of mind for when I do have to lock my bike outside of a store, but it stows away nicely the rest of the time.
customer_reviews.author: James Lin

customer_reviews.title: Very functional bike lock
customer_reviews.text: Mechanically, this has a very smooth operation - with an easy click lock, and an easy to use folding mechanism. It is very intuitive to put together. Love its compact size and mounting options. The accompanying pouch fits very nicely using velcro around my bike frame - so I don't have to carry it around in my backpack. So far no one has made off with the pouch itself - and hopefully they won't in the future as well, as the lock itself is very bulky and heavy otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ammy_Evaluator

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Unique
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy and unique lock. I love that it's easier to carry than a traditional chain or cable lock. You can literally fold it and put it in your back pocket which makes it highly portable. The steel bars are strong and durable. It is easy to use. I appreciate that the company states that this is a mid-range security level lock. A motivated thief will be able to cut through it with bolt cutters, but this will most likely deter an inexperienced one.
customer_reviews.author: LVesper

customer_reviews.title: Really is good for low risk
customer_reviews.text: The description says it’s good for “low theft risk” locations and it is. Even then if someone wants to get your bike, they probably will. I like these locks because they fold up compactly. Sure you can mount it to your bike, but also easy to toss into a bag because the size and shape. YMMV with how much of your bike you can lock up, but in the low theft risk areas you’ll certainly be able to lock up enough. It shouldn’t scratch your bike at all.
customer_reviews.author: anonymousY

customer_reviews.title: It travels nice and neatly in a casing that attaches to the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a unique shape for a bike lock. In the first part of the description is says for use in a low theft area. Later in the description it says it offers medium security against theft. By just looking and holding it I would think it was mostly indestructible but after reading previous reviews it see that it is not. Nothing is 100 percent. It travels nice and neatly in a casing that attaches to the bike. It is a keyed device not combination lock.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Everson

customer_reviews.title: Neat and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This Abus Bordo 5700 Folding Lock is very convenient because it can be neatly installed on the bike frame or taken with you in your backpack. It's much better than using a chain lock. The color is pleasant. Personally, I prefer numeric, or keyless lock as I don't like to carry a key with me. However, for what it is, this is a great folding lock. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mat633

customer_reviews.title: Very solid lock
customer_reviews.text: I generally like this lock and the adaptability of use in multiple situations. I use it to secure my Barbequer and ice chest while camping. It’s solid! But it’s awfully heavy. It weighs well over 2 pounds, so I wouldn’t recommend it on the go for securing a bike.
customer_reviews.author: jade7

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Very Convenient, and is not a hassle to lug around. This is a lock I would recommend to anyone who just needs a peace of mind while getting groceries, coffee, etc. Feels very heavy duty, I wouldn’t use this for overnight purposes but only for quick stops.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Clever design
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat way to make a bicycle lock that tucks away nicely. They are upfront that this isn't the highest level of security out there, but it is fine for doing things like riding your bike into campus during the day, etc. The lock and links between sections move freely and easily. Good product, clever design.
customer_reviews.author: Bukkene Bruse

customer_reviews.title: cool design but quite heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is made in Germany! I found the idea cool, and like mounting it to the water bottle area on the bike, but it is quite heavy. Having multiple mounting options is great too. Comes with two keys and security level is 7 out of 15.
customer_reviews.author: Jong Lee

customer_reviews.title: Hefty, a little too much
customer_reviews.text: Secure "cable" lock for just about anything. It comes with mounting gear for your bike. I strapped this onto my bike and it added significant heft. And for those who do a lot of long distance riding and are concerned with every ounce, this lock is not for you. I would have also appreciated combination access instead of having to use a key - just another potential items to misplace!
customer_reviews.author: Jish M.

product_meta.title: Abus Bordo 5700 Folding Lock
product_meta.description: The latest in folding lock innovation from ABUS, the Bordo 5700 has non-hardened steel bars making it the perfect security solution for suburban and low theft risk locations. The lock is lightweight but sturdy!
feature_bullets: Premium cylinder for high protection against manipulations, like picking

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
